intro: Pseudostellaria heterantha var. nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal starwort, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. Its leaves are opposite and linear, with a hairy surface that helps reduce water loss in cold climates. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
